An Act to make provision for the promotion, funding, management and regulation of rural electrification; and for matters connected therewith and incidental thereto
ENACTED by the Parliament of Malawi as follows -
PART I  -  PRELIMINARY
•Credit Finance Manager•
means the Credit Finance Manager to be appointed under Section 19.
"Fund"
means the Malawi Rural Electrification Fund established under section 12;
"Grant and Subsidy Agreement"

means the agreement entered into between the Concedante and the Concessionaire for purposes of channelling funds from the Fund to the Concessionaire for rural electrification and as contemplated in section 21;
•Grid Extension Rural Electrification"
means rural electrification installation that is connected to the interconnected system;
"Interconnected System"

means the high voltage national electricity system of 66KV and above, (or as may be prescribed by notice in the Gazette) including related substations and associated equipment and generation stations to which they are connected and any distribution system connected thereto;
"Malawi Bureau of Standards"
means the statutory body established under the Malawi Bureau of Standards Act;
"Management fee"
means the fee payable by a Concessionaire to a Concedante in accordance with section 29;
"Micro hydropower station"
means a hydropower station whose installed generation capacity is not less than 2KW but is less than 100KW;
"Mini hydropower station"
is a hydropower station whose installed generation capacity is not less than 100KW but is less than 500KW;
•Minister•
means the Minister responsible for energy affairs;
"off grid rural electrification"
means rural electrification installation that is not connected to the interconnected system;
•Public Institutions•
means Government schools, hospitals, clinics, health centres, police stations and other Government offices and institutions.
"renewable energy resources"
means solar home system, micro, mini and small hydro electric power station, biomas, biogas, wind, and other thermal electricity generation systems and technologies;
•Rural electrification•

means grid extension or off grid electrification and/or renewable energy resources electrification whose internal rate of return is up to 6% per annum and line capacity is lower than 66Kv and/or generation capacity is up to 5MW.
"rural electrification programme"
means the rural electrification programme prepared or compiled in accordance with section 35;
"rural electrification site"
means a site where rural electrification installation is in progress or under commercial operation;
"Rural Electrification Unit"
means the Rural Electrification Unit in the Department of Energy Affairs;
"small hydropower station"
means a hydropower station whose installed generation capacity is not less than 500KW and up to 5MW;
"solar home system"
means photovoltaic solar home systems technology as contemplated in section 32;
"Solar Home System Purchase, Guarantee and Service Agreement"

means the agreement entered into between the Concedante or Purchaser and the Concessionaire or between the Concessionaire and the supplier of Solar Home System equipment for the purpose of purchase, guarantee and service of the same as contemplated in section 32.
PART II  -  ESTABLISHMENT OF  RURAL ELECTRIFICATION MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
The Minister shall appoint one of the members of the  committee as Chairperson of the committee.
The objectives of the Committee shall be -
For the purpose of achieving the objectives set out in
develop a rural electrification master plan and update it at regular intervals;
set criteria for candidate site selection;
act as a source of technical, commercial and institutional advice;
seek and access donor funding and soft credit for rural electrification;
undertake publicity and marketing campaigns on the new approach to rural electrification and the opportunities provided;
contract and oversee the construction and management of rural electrification projects;
administer the Fund and decide on the allocation of financial resources from the Fund;
monitor implementation of rural electrification projects by Concessionaires;
carry out or commission studies and research for promoting the development of rural electrification;
advise the Authority on the specifications, design and safety standards for rural electrification systems, equipment and technologies;
advise the Authority on the prices for solar home system equipment and on the tariffs and maintenance charges for rural electrification;
advise the Minister on the appropriate amount to be appropriated by Parliament for the Fund;
in liaison with the Authority, carry out evaluations and publish periodic reports of the activities and achievements of the Committee;
prepare, publish and submit to the Minister audited annual accounts of the Fund;
Meetings of the Committee
do all such things as are necessary for achieving the purposes for which the Committee and the Fund are established.
(1) The  Committee shall meet at least once every six  months at such place or places and at such time or  times     as the Chairperson may determine.

The Chairperson shall preside at the meetings of the  Committee and, in the absence of the Chairperson, the  members present and forming a quorum shall elect one of their number to preside over the meeting of  the  Committee and the member so elected shall exercise all the powers and functions and perform all  the duties of the Chairperson.

At any meeting the decision of the Committee on any  matter shall be that of the majority of the members  present and at all such meetings the person presiding  shall have, in the event of an equality of votes a casting vote in addition to his deliberative vote.
Save as otherwise provided in this section, the Committee shall have power to determine its own procedure of meetings and operating guidelines.

The  members  of  the  Committee shall be paid from the  proceeds of the Fund such allowances as the Minister, on the recommendation of the Committee, may determine, and the  Committee shall make provision for the reimbursement of any reasonable expenses incurred by a member of the Committee in connection with the business of the Committee.

(1) The Committee may in its discretion at any time, and for  any  length of  period, coopt any person to attend deliberations of the Committee but such person shall not be  entitled to vote on any matter.

The Committee may in its discretion engage any advisor or consultant to carry out any assignment on behalf of the Committee in relation to rural electrification and pay him or her out of the proceeds of the Fund.

(1) The Committee shall be responsible and accountable the Minister for ensuring efficiency, transparency and     propriety in -
* the collection, allocation and utilization of funds of the Fund;
* the conduct of its business and the performance of its functions and duties; and
* the operations and activities of the Committee.
(1) The Committee shall be responsible and accountable the Minister for ensuring efficiency, transparency and     propriety in -

The Committee shall at such intervals as the Minister may in writing require submit to the Minister reports and financial statements, in such form as the Minister may determine, regarding the operations and activities of the Committee and the Fund.
(1)  The Rural Electrification Unit shall provide Secretarial services and resources to the Committee.
The members of staff of the Rural Electrification Unit shall carry out the day to day work and operations of the Committee as the Committee may, from time to time, require.

The Committee may delegate to the Director of Energy Affairs functions and duties of the Committee and the supervision of the said staff members carrying out the day to day work and operations of the Committee.

Save as otherwise provided in this Act, the Director of Energy Affairs and members of staff of the Rural Electrification Unit shall not be entitled to any additional remuneration by reason only of their carrying out the functions for or of the Committee.
Members of staff of the Rural Electrification Unit or the Department of Energy Affairs may, at the invitation of the Committee, or for purposes of presenting reports attend meetings of the Committee.
PART III  -  ESTABLISHMENT OF MALAWI RURAL ELECTRIFICATION  FUND
audited annually by independent Public Auditors appointed by the Committee; and
examined by the Auditor General before being presented to the Minister in accordance with section 22.
Annual report

The financial year of the Fund shall be a period of twelve  months commencing on 1st July in each year and ending on 30th June in the following year, or on such other dates as the Minister may specify by order published in the
Gazette:

Provided that the first financial year of the Fund may be a shorter or longer period than twelve months as the Minister may determine, but being not less than six months nor more than eighteen months.

(1) As soon as practicable, but not later than six months after the expiry of each financial year, the Committee shall submit to the Minister an annual report concerning rural electrification and the Fund during that financial year.
The annual report referred to in subsection (1) shall  include -

PART VI  -  MANAGEMENT OF RURAL ELECTRIFICATION ACTIVITIES
projects:

Provided that where a Concessionaire or consumers are able and willing to contribute up to 20% of the capital cost of the project  for grid or off grid electrification or up to 50% for renewable energy project such a project will gain additional priority on the priority list.
Promotion of rural
The  Committee shall  take steps and do all things electrification necessary to promote, attract, encourage, facilitate and  market rural electrification in Malawi and in particular shall -
conduct civic education to the peri-urban and rural population on the advantages of and opportunities available in rural electrification services and technologies;

conduct market research on the acceptance or satisfaction of rural electrification customers with rural electrification technologies and services for purposes of attracting potential customers to rural electrification;
provide to potential customers, investors, concessionaires, donors, beneficiaries, and all others, information regarding rural electrification in Malawi;
develop and promote a favourable image of rural electrification for Malawi;
undertake rural electrification promotion missions within and outside Malawi;

recommend to the Minister changes in the statutory and administrative framework which act as barriers to the promotion of rural electrification in Malawi and make representations against or regarding any changes to such statutory or administrative framework;
develop and promote strategies aimed at building confidence among various stakeholders in rural electrification services and technologies;
develop and promote strategies aimed at ensuring the sustainability of rural electrification in Malawi;
develop and promote strategies aimed at increasing the access to energy sources by the majority of the peri-urban and rural population in Malawi and raise their living
Passed in Parliament this nineteenth day of March two thousand and four

document_description: This act makes provision for the promotion, funding, management and regulation of rural electrification. Specific, more favourable rules are laid out for renewable energy resources, including in terms of finance.
